availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Anne Eliza Hynes c.December 31, 1833. Father of Louisa Slaughter, William Slaughter, Brenda Slaughter, Daniel Slaughter, Kate Slaughter, Andrew Slaughter, Thomas Slaughter, and Emma Slaughter. Attorney in Nelson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 278B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 155.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 105.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 136.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film #000009668, Nelson County, December 31, 1833, (accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film # 994050, Nelson County, October 1, 1856 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Daniel Strother Slaughter (1809-1863)” Memorial #123343424, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/123343424/daniel-strother-slaughter (accessed February 9, 2019).
